meanings.sent1: The game felt rigged against me from the start.
meanings.sent2: The rigged election results were finally exposed.
meanings.sent3: It was clear the rigged dice were causing all the trouble.
meanings.sent4: The rigged system favored only a select few.
meanings.sent5: The rigged scales always showed a higher weight than reality.

meanings.sent1: The rigged ship sailed smoothly across the ocean.
meanings.sent2: The sailors worked hard to maintain the rigged sails.
meanings.sent3: The rigged boat looked majestic under the setting sun.
meanings.sent4: The rigged mast stood tall against the clear blue sky.
meanings.sent5: The rigged rigging creaked softly in the gentle breeze.

meanings.definition: To set up or prepare for a particular purpose
meanings.sent1: He rigged the stage for the upcoming performance.
meanings.sent2: They rigged the tent for the outdoor event.
meanings.sent3: She rigged the lights to create a cozy atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: The team rigged the equipment for the experiment.
meanings.sent5: Rigging the decorations took longer than expected.
